intro: Psychotria coussareoides var. ciliata, commonly known as the ciliated psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with cilia along the margins, giving it its specific epithet. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
